intro: Lens culinaris subsp. macrosperma, commonly known as the large-seeded lentil, is a cultivated variety of the lentil plant. It is characterized by its larger seeds compared to other subspecies, which are typically oval or lens-shaped. The plant is an annual legume that thrives in temperate climates and is widely grown for its nutritional seeds. It has a shallow root system and is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, improving soil fertility. The pods contain 10–20 seeds, which are harvested when dry and mature.
